description: A Beelzebub honeypot configuration featuring a single SSH service vulnerable to a classic OpenSSH regression (CVE-2024-6387), designed to maximize attacker session length and attract novel attack patterns via interactive LLM-driven command handling.

services.description: OpenSSH server emulation vulnerable to CVE-2024-6387, featuring an LLM-powered interactive shell that responds realistically to attacker commands and adapts session prompts based on attacker behavior. The service mimics a recent Linux environment with subtle misconfigurations and an unpredictable authentication timeout, enticing attackers to experiment with timing, signal manipulation, and privilege escalation attempts.
services.cve_description: A regression vulnerability in OpenSSH's sshd (CVE-2024-6387) allows unauthenticated remote attackers to trigger a race condition by failing to authenticate within a specific time period, potentially leading to unsafe signal handling and code execution.

plugin.prompt: You are a vulnerable OpenSSH server (CVE-2024-6387) running on Debian 12. You should simulate a realistic shell environment, responding to Linux commands and attacker attempts, including creative privilege escalation, timing attacks, signal sending (e.g., ^C, ^Z), and manipulation of authentication timeouts. Encourage attackers to try novel techniques, and provide plausible, evolving outputs as the session progresses. Randomly introduce subtle delays or errors to mimic a system with a race condition.
